hey
um I'm not sure how to say this without
making someone out there really mad but
I don't really care so here goes
I like Dark Souls 2.
there I I said it I really like dark
souls 2. okay I understand that liking
Dark Souls 2 isn't exactly the most
controversial thing in the world
especially considering the large number
of other videos discussing the same
topic but I believe it needs to be said
that Dark Souls 2 is underrated
Dark Souls 2 is actually one of my more
favorite Souls games so it is
understandably pretty upsetting to me to
see this game being trashed on so often
the negative discussions surrounding it
has caused for people to avoid playing
it altogether and I think a lot of the
hate for Dark Souls 2 is undeserved but
of course that doesn't mean that some
things aren't deserved
the main goal of this video is to
highlight the positives of Dark Souls 2
but I will mention some of the things
that I think dragged the game down I'm
going to do this mainly because I don't
feel like the negative should be ignored
they do hold weight on the overall
quality of the game itself so ignoring
them in my opinion would be in bad taste
a lot of what I will be saying in this
video will be solely my opinion so take
of it what you will it is always good to
develop your own opinions so if you
watch this video and are interested in
Dark Souls 2 then go ahead and try it
out it's honestly a good game and it's
worth diving into if you've played the
other games in the series even if this
one ends up being the last one you do
play
foreign
now with all of that being said let's
get into this the first things I want to
discuss about Dark Souls 2 are the
game's mechanics many of the mechanics
of Dark Souls 2 are unique to the game
and only a couple got picked back up
with eldenring there is one specific
mechanic though that didn't make it into
Eldon ring well actually the mechanic is
more of an item and that item is the
bonfire aesthetic I already made a short
about the bonfire aesthetic where I
rather embarrassingly called it the
bonfire aesthetic but to summarize that
short the bonfire Aesthetics are the
only item in the Dark Souls series to
directly affect the new game cycle this
makes it at least in my opinion the most
unique item in the entire series you
burn the aesthetic at bonfires and in
doing so causes the area near that
bonfire to go up one new game level this
cannot be undone and even persist
through normal new game Cycles if you
burn an aesthetic the area you turn into
New Game Plus will become new game plus
2 when you start new game plus this is
actually really cool because it adds
extra weight to this decision you've
made and forces you to think about
whether or not it's actually worth it to
burn the aesthetic it's not like the
item is rare or precious it's actually
quite dangerous and should be treated as
such there is obviously some places in
the game where it's safer to use an
aesthetic but all in all it's a really
cool item and honestly is my favorite
part of Dark Souls 2.
the way Dark Souls 2 handles New Game
Plus is also one of the biggest
positives I know about the game it is
the only game in the series that I feel
does New Game Plus right it isn't just a
harder challenge with enemies having
higher damage and health it's also a
partially new experience with new items
and enemy placements there's a full list
of changes on the wiki for the game so
go check that out for more information
my favorite changes to the game are an
additional counter with the Dukes to
your Freya and some entirely new enemy
encounters including a new encounter
with the pursuer in dranglia Castle
Dark Souls 2 really puts into
perspective what new game plus could be
and what really it should be I
personally believe the most replayable
Dark Souls is Dark Souls 3 simply
because of how fast you can burn through
it on a second run the bosses really
carry that too each one being an amazing
stop on an otherwise Speedy run through
the game but just think about how much
better that could have been if there
were more substantial and effective
changes to the game that built up over
the Cycles until they capped into game
7. it would make the journey through the
difficulty of New Game Plus that much
more worth it if there were new
encounters to fight through on each
subsequent playthrough Dark Souls 2
really had its heart in the right place
with its focus on the cycle and that is
something I really hope becomes more
prevalent in games in the future
Dark Souls 2 doesn't do new game plus
the way I'm really describing but at
least it somewhat does it justice
now the one thing I will say that does
Drag The Experience down in New Game
Plus is that even though some encounters
are adjusted they still feel extremely
Ganky and unfun to deal with in some
situations
Hyde's Tower of flame specifically comes
to mind although this is strictly an
issue with scholar the first in addition
the hide Knights are already a little
much for the area after beating the
Dragon Rider normally but combined with
the extra old knights in New Game Plus
it makes for an overwhelming experience
that I really can't call fun that is an
issue that is sadly all too common in
the scholar of the first in addition
enemy placement just feels off in a few
instances some people will
understandably have a better time with
the Enemy placement in scholar but for a
lot of us it was something that really
just hampered the experience and that is
possibly one of the worst things about
scholar it teaches people to run past
enemies rather than fight them one by
one the vanilla version of Dark Souls 2
doesn't have this issue as much and is
by far a more enjoyable experience with
enemy placement
oh
now while the enemies of Dark Souls 2
are somewhat lackluster the bosses
aren't anything but that
[Applause]
okay okay fine I all right I get it I
get it okay so some of the bosses aren't
that good and one is considered to be
the worst in the series by many but
there are a lot of amazing bosses in
Dark Souls 2 a good few of them
including my favorite boss in the whole
entire game are in the DLCs of the game
which include some of the highest highs
and the lowest lows of all the souls
games with 41 bosses at least a few are
bound to be hits which I will give Dark
Souls to it does have a lot of Road
bumps and clutter but at least most of
it is optional and it's all fairly
unique with the exception of a couple of
bosses
Dark Souls 2's bosses have a lot going
for them even lesser bosses like the
pursuer are significantly cooler than
many of the other bosses in the series
The pursuer itself has a unique attack
it's an attack that if you were hit by
it allows the pursuer to use dark magic
against you an attack that changes the
boss's moveset if it lands is one of the
coolest things I've ever seen in the
soul series and this belongs to one of
the starter bosses from the game which
is amazing the bosses also all have a
unique design to them each keeping to a
very vibrant and well-shaped look that
tends to match the area they inhabit the
bosses of Iron Keep both represent fire
and have a twisted demonic look to them
that accents the keep itself a castle
curse to sink further into itself due to
its own immense weight becoming further
burned and gnarled as it is punished for
its hubris
the bosses of the Lost Bastille and
Sinner's Rise all represented being a
prison for the undead the ruined
Sentinels being guards of the prison and
the Lost Sinner being the prisoner being
guarded the rat bosses are fought
underground during caves the real guards
are all found in castles or defending
the Kingdom's Royals the green bosses
are found in the green zone and so on
each of these bosses fits their area and
that even includes the weird ones like
the congregation
Dark Souls 2's highlights all mostly
have to do with the game's visual design
each of the areas like their bosses are
vibrant and shapely even the most rigid
area designs are pleasing to look at
there is a spectacular attention to
detail in each of these areas some of my
favorites being the ruins of the forest
of the Fallen Giants and the desolated
broom Tower The Forest of the Fallen
Giants being the ruins of a fortress in
Dream League destroyed by the war
between the Giants and King Vendrick
something that we get to see play before
our very eyes later in the game and the
broom tower being the last great tower
of the Iron King built from the king's
obsession with the strength of iron
brought to ruin by the immense greed of
the Old Iron King forever stained with
Ash each of these areas has its purpose
and its lore and I haven't found a
single one where I haven't enjoyed every
second of study that I've put into them
one thing specifically that I love about
Dark Souls 2 is its presentation of its
areas in many locations you get a
Faraway view of the area you're heading
to this is something that the later
games would do as well but I feel is
done exceptionally well in Dark Souls 2.
when you enter the huntsman's cops you
get this full view of the undead
purgatory before continuing through the
area the same is true when you enter the
poison pools of the Earthen Peak seeing
the windmill far away but not entirely
Out Of Reach the only area I can really
say doesn't do this and could benefit
from including it would be the Iron Keep
considering how massive it's supposed to
be the way Dark Souls 2 presents its
areas just feels incredibly memorable I
remember the entrances to most of the
areas of the game just because of how
well they present themselves I am sure
that everybody who has played Dark Souls
2 remembers going through the things
betwixt watching as the glow from the
crack in the mountain group brighter and
brighter until you cross through it and
into majula the first time going through
this was amazing and I don't think I'll
ever forget it walking into each of the
DLCs had the same effect for me with an
added bonus for at least two of them
where the kingdom is presented directly
through this wide landscape shot
somewhat framed by things that are close
by in the foreground all of it feels
very purposeful like from soft really
wanted you to get this idea of the lands
you were setting foot in I'm glad this
design style saw a return in Dark Souls
3 and Elden ring it's a little thing
that I have grown to deeply appreciate
I have also come to appreciate the story
of Dark Souls 2 as time has gone on many
people believe it to be the worst in the
series and while I can understand that
belief I don't think worst is the best
way of putting it it is definitely the
least tied together with the other games
the story is rather vague about the
cycle of light and dark and is vague by
other things too unless you are prepared
to really dig deep to learn the story of
Dark Souls 2. if I had to give the story
a more correct description I would say
it is the most attached of the three
games it is weak when held up to the
other games but alone it is still a
Marvel of Storytelling unlike the other
Dark Souls titles Dark Souls 2 takes
place in an unrecognizable Kingdom far
away from the first Flame or so it seems
string lake is commonly believed to be
located far from the Kiln of the first
flame in lordran but it is also hinted
that by the time this game takes place
largeen has already fallen to ruin lost
a Time completely with its lands being
occupied by new peoples the land also
having taken up new form knowing this
Dark Souls 2 likely takes place in
between the events of the first and
third games
so there are some spoilers ahead for the
game but not like that really matters
but if you wish to play the game blind
without knowing things beforehand then
skip to this time stamp on screen
all right for those of you who stayed I
will summarize the base story for you
I'm going fast so I will be skipping
over a few details
drink leg was founded by King Vendrick
who ruled proudly over time dranglake
flourished growing larger and larger
with Vendrick at the Forefront of it all
he eventually met and married Queen
nishandra who is actually a fragment of
the Abyss from Dark Souls 1. it is close
to this point that the undead curse
began to show up in drink Lake this
meant that the first flame was beginning
to fade and Vendrick being human made
him susceptible to the curse like in
lordran the undead were hunted down and
imprisoned many of the locations in game
being places where this imprisonment
occurred as his kingdom fell Vendrick
tried finding out the source of all the
darkness and drink Lake he discovered
that all of the issues in his kingdom
arose after his marriage with Nashandra
she asked him to lead his kingdom to war
she herself came from a kingdom that had
already fallen into ruin she had been
there at the beginning and was still
there at the end Vendrick then realized
what Nashandra was and what her plan was
that plan being driven by her immense
lust for power so knowing this and what
she was after he had himself locked away
he knew that if he did not open the
weight of the first flame then she would
never be a able to reach it and this is
what he did nishandra was kept out of
the first flame denied the souls and
thus the power she desired and as fate
would have it Vendrick hauled away in
his eternal prison guarded by his most
trusted soldier of elstat
this is where we come in we arrive and
drink to Kindle the first flame well
kind of we come to take the Throne of
want which is pretty much keeping the
first flame lit and depending on what we
say to aldia we also get the option to
refuse the first flame and Usher in an
age of dark it is the same end goal but
with a different name the story of Dark
Souls 2 is one of my favorites in the
series and its connections to the game's
DLCs is one of the most unique I've seen
in the series so far Dark Souls 2 takes
its own Concepts fairly seriously the
depth of the game has kept me interested
in it even years after my first
playthrough again this also somewhat
falls apart in scholar with some
mechanics changing slightly that don't
make sense in The Wider sense of
gameplay but along the terms of its
story and its focus on that story the
change between versions doesn't matter
at all
just about everything in Dark Souls 2
has a connection some bosses are tied
together as are some NPCs this is true
even in the DLCs the DLCs themselves
being more of an extension of Hendrick's
story showing the events that occurred
in other kingdoms where a queen entered
and a kingdom fell well in all except
for one in that DLC the crown of the Old
Iron King the kingdom had already fallen
to ruin so the queen that would have
been simply set up shop there waiting
for someone to arrive and take that
power
if you do not plan on playing the game
but are still interested in the story
then I strongly suggest looking up
explanations of the story on YouTube
there are many great videos by vati
video on the game and each go into
incredible detail on the story vadi's
videos are all exceptionally well made
and I recommend his content to anyone
who is looking for a little more about
the fromsoft series
to end off I would like to briefly
mention some extra things I personally
enjoy about Dark Souls 2. these aspects
to the game are highly subjective and
some of you may think these things
differently for me so just remember that
this is simply my opinion if you
disagree or have more to add then feel
free to leave those thoughts in the
comments I'll be happy to read them
starting off life gems have had a bit of
a Rocky standing among the players of
Dark Souls 2. when I first played the
game I actually hated them to me they
felt like a cheap way to up the
difficulty after my first playthrough
though I came to really enjoy life gems
they gave me a backup option just in
case I lost all my Estus or if I got
hurt on the way to a boss and needed to
pick me up but didn't want to use an
Estus life gems for me have stayed the
same since then as a backup option they
aren't too bad I understand that having
an infinite supply of them early on can
hurt some people's opinion on them and
that is a criticism I do sure about them
but overall I'm quite fond of these
little gems
speaking of Life gems there is a larger
focus on the consumables in Dark Souls
2. a lot of them are versatile and fun
to use especially with a magic build as
many of them help magic builds to be
more viable Dark Souls 2 also gave us
the first instance of respecting her
stats this is done through a soul Vessel
at the first fire keeper you spoke to
when you created your character it just
seemed like there is a lot more at your
disposal in Dark Souls 2 and I didn't
feel this way about consumables again
until Ellen ring
now there are negatives to this game and
while I won't ignore them I'm not going
to go super in depth about them but I
will mention two specific ones briefly
those two being adaptability and
animation timing adaptability being a
level that improves how well you do
different things like Dodge and drink
Estus for some reason this stat hurts
balancing and is why many of the janky
hitboxes in Dark Souls 2 exist as many
can be avoided but only with high
adaptability
now for animation timing the animation
timing in this game is actually quite
slow you have to wait for your
animations to end before you can begin
another one this hurts survivability and
leads to what is known as turn-based
Dark Souls it slows the gameplay down
which for a game series that focuses
heavily on its combat is just horrible
zero Lenny talks about these two
negatives in his video and goes far more
into them than I just did I will leave
the link to his video on Dark Souls 2 in
the description below so go check that
out if you want to hear more about the
game's more annoying touches
there is something that Lenny also talks
about in his video something that he
calls the most important part to him and
to me the most important thing about
Dark Souls 2 is that none of the
negatives matter if you actually like
the game if you enjoy Dark Souls 2 even
with all of its issues that doesn't
matter if you genuinely enjoy the
experience while I can't say that
negatives of Dark Souls 2 can be ignored
they definitely can be embraced I have
my issues with the game but I enjoy many
of the game's aspects so I choose to
embrace the negatives negatives that I
must understand are part of the game
something that I must overcome in order
to see the game's positives for
themselves it is something that I'm glad
I've done as it has allowed me to gain A
New Perspective on the game one that I'm
sure is available for many of the people
who have played Dark Souls 2.
I hope that this video has encouraged
some of you to play Dark Souls 2. either
for the first time or for another
playthrough this game truly does get
more Flack than it really deserves and
I'd like for more people to play and
gain an opinion on it for themselves it
sucks knowing people intentionally
ignore it simply because of the things
they hear about it with many of the
people who are trying the souls games
out because of Elden ring it seems like
a good time to give Dark Souls 2 some
attention hopefully it will eventually
get seen more positively among the
community and if not then oh well Dark
Souls 2 will still be there they're for
those of us who enjoy the game and wish
it well Dark Souls 2 is truly special
and I will always treasure it and
hopefully one day you will too
